pullRequest.body:
In two files, only reduce the scope of it;
the other occurrences seem harder to remove.

bors d+

```suggestion
variable {ι : Sort*} {α β : Type*}
```
to avoid needing it below.
Let's just use `α` and `β` here to match the rest of the section?
Done; and also re-used alpha and beta in a few more places.

```suggestion
```

Generally data comes after typeclasses:
```suggestion
theorem iInf_le_coatom [Order.Coframe α] {a : α} (ha : IsCoatom a) {f : ι → α} :
```
Thanks, TIL!
Maybe hoist `beta` to the top of the file, if that works?
It does; done!

```suggestion
theorem coe_mk {h} : ⇑(⟨f, h⟩ : r ↪r s) = f :=
```
is a good option here to avoid having to write anything verbose.

```suggestion
set_option autoImplicit true in
```
That option was meant to be global for the remaining file - but indeed, it can be removed as well; I just pushed a commit doing so.
Maybe you add here `s` and `t`?

I've checked: the file uses s and t for various things; there's no consistent pattern.
I think it's more readable as-is. (Refactoring that file is a good follow-up idea, though I'd probably start by splitting the file...)
I think `variable {x : \a}` is a good idea.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Order): remove almost all autoImplicit
